intro: Chaetanthera boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has a compact, herbaceous structure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate beauty.
